snippet: Beijing has demanded that Vietnam withdraw ships from around a Chinese drilling rig, the latest volley in an escalating standoff over parts of the South China Sea.
abstract: China demands withdrawal of Vietnamese ships near giant Chinese drilling rig and for the first time acknowledges its vessels had blasted the Vietnamese flotilla with cannons; latest back-and-forth in dispute with Vietnam sends Vietnamese stock market plunging and elicits concern in Washington.

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Beijing, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Beijing has demanded that Vietnam withdraw ships from around a Chinese drilling rig, the latest volley in an escalating standoff over parts of the South China Sea.

headline.main: China Flexes Its Muscles in Dispute With Vietnam
headline.print_headline: China Flexes Its Muscles in Dispute With Vietnam
